chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Yerin Y. Izaguirre, appeared with Attorney John Anthony Ward.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Ward. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. DE has oral motion to allow DE attend a funeral services of S.R (5 yr old drowning victim) where minors may be present; arguments heard;  Court will allow the DE to attend the funeral services/ luncheon  for S.R. but all other bond conditions remain.   Scheduling Order given to Atty Ward in court today.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
